bugs.title: CVE-2022-1354 libtiff: heap-buffer-overflow in TIFFReadRawDataStriped() in tiffinfo.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-1354 libtiff: heap-buffer-overflow in TIFFReadRawDataStriped() in tiffinfo.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-1354 libtiff: heap-buffer-overflow in TIFFReadRawDataStriped() in tiffinfo.c

long_desc.thetext:
A heap-buffer-overflow flaw was found in TIFFReadRawDataStriped() function in tiffinfo.c.

References:
https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/issues/319
https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/commit/87f580f39011109b3bb5f6eca13fac543a542798

Created libtiff tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2075479]


Created mingw-libtiff tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2075480]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Via RHSA-2022:8194 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:8194

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2022-1354

bugs.title: CVE-2022-1623 libtiff: out-of-bounds read in LZWDecode [fedora-35]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-1623 libtiff: out-of-bounds read in LZWDecode [fedora-35]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-1623 libtiff: out-of-bounds read in LZWDecode

long_desc.thetext:
LibTIFF master branch has an out-of-bounds read in LZWDecode in libtiff/tif_lzw.c:624, allowing attackers to cause a denial-of-service via a crafted tiff file. For users that compile libtiff from sources, the fix is available with commit b4e79bfa.

https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/commit/b4e79bfa0c7d2d08f6f1e7ec38143fc8cb11394a
https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/issues/410
https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/cves/-/blob/master/2022/CVE-2022-1623.json

Created iv tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-34 [bug 2084261]

Created iv tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-35 [bug 2084265]


Created libtiff tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-34 [bug 2084263]
Affects: fedora-35 [bug 2084266]


Created mingw-libtiff tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-34 [bug 2084264]
Affects: fedora-35 [bug 2084267]

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2022-1623

bugs.title: CVE-2022-1622 libtiff: out-of-bounds read in LZWDecode [fedora-35]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-1622 libtiff: out-of-bounds read in LZWDecode [fedora-35]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-1622 libtiff: out-of-bounds read in LZWDecode

long_desc.thetext:
LibTIFF master branch has an out-of-bounds read in LZWDecode in libtiff/tif_lzw.c:619, allowing attackers to cause a denial-of-service via a crafted tiff file. For users that compile libtiff from sources, the fix is available with commit b4e79bfa.

https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/commit/b4e79bfa0c7d2d08f6f1e7ec38143fc8cb11394a
https://gitlab.com/libtiff/libtiff/-/issues/410
https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/cves/-/blob/master/2022/CVE-2022-1622.json

Created iv tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-35 [bug 2084273]

Affects: fedora-35 [bug 2084274]

Affects: fedora-35 [bug 2084275]
